text:
```julia> kwargs
2-element Vector{Expr}:
 :(limit::A = 10)
 :(offset::B = 50)

julia> ex = quote function foo($(kwargs...)) end end
quote
    #= REPL[124]:1 =#
    function foo($(Expr(:(=), :(limit::A), 10)), $(Expr(:(=), :(offset::B), 50)))
        #= REPL[124]:1 =#
        #= REPL[124]:1 =#
    end
end```
how can I make it so the args in the function are `foo(limit::A = 10, offset::B = 50)`

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>
<@U6CF3AA5Q> do you want these to be positional arguments or keyword arguments?

elements.text: do you want these to be positional arguments or keyword arguments?

text:
I'm going to assume positional arguments.
```julia> args = [:(limit::A = 10), :(offset::B = 50)];

julia> args2 = map(args) do arg
           arg = copy(arg)
           arg.head = :kw
           arg
       end
2-element Vector{Expr}:
 :($(Expr(:kw, :(limit::A), 10)))
 :($(Expr(:kw, :(offset::B), 50)))

julia> ex = quote function foo($(args2...)) end end
quote
    #= REPL[25]:1 =#
    function foo(limit::A = 10, offset::B = 50)
        #= REPL[25]:1 =#
        #= REPL[25]:1 =#
    end
end```
